purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to define patches of colour, shading or texture on a 2D drawing.
purpose.note: These patches of colour, shading or texture may be interpreted in accordance with draughting conventions to gain understanding about the nature of a product.
purpose.p: This edition incorporates modifications to the previous edition listed below.

li.p: items within the scope of application interpreted construct "Draughting annotation", ISO 10303-504:

ul.li: the presentation of non-shape product data depicted by two-dimensional or planar three-dimensional annotation;
the structures for representing the presentation characteristics of annotation;
the structures for representing subfigures and symbols;
the structures for representing externally defined symbols and presentation characteristics;

li.p: the explicit definition of a patch, or assembly of patches, of colour, shading or texture by reference to:

ul.li: position and orientation, a text string, and a style for presenting a text string;
a position and a style for presenting a point;
a curve and a style for presenting a curve;
boundary curves for a filled area, and a style for presenting a filled area;

inscope.li: items within the scope of application module Draughting element, ISO/TS 10303-1310.

outscope.li: the definition of a position, orientation or curve.

uof.name: Draughting_annotation
uof.description: The Draughting annotation UoF specifies a patch, or assembly of patches, of colour, shading or texture on a 2D drawing.
